meanings.definition: Intuitionists: Those who believe in the doctrine that moral principles can be known directly through intuition.
meanings.sent1: Many intuitionists trust their gut feelings when making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The intuitionists in the group relied on their instincts to guide them.
meanings.sent3: The intuitionists at the party always seemed to know when the pizza would arrive.
meanings.sent4: She was like an intuitionist detective, solving mysteries without any evidence.
meanings.sent5: The intuitionists were like human lie detectors, sensing deception effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Intuitionists: A group of philosophers who emphasize the role of intuition in the acquisition of knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The intuitionists in the class often talked about trusting their inner feelings.
meanings.sent2: During the debate, the intuitionists argued for the importance of intuition in learning.
meanings.sent3: The intuitionists' philosophy club meetings were always full of unexpected insights.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like an intuitionist compass, always pointing her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The intuitionists' ideas floated in the air like magical whispers, captivating everyone.
